data.title: Fun for Art Prize
data.text: Most recently attended during art prize. Happened on a short free symphony concert, which was wonderful and beautiful. Admission was free and there were one or two interesting pieces. It's quite a small museum, so don't expect much more than 30 minutes to walk through.

data.title: Art?
data.text: The question should be: Why is this institute driven to make a social comment instead of letting the nature of the art reveal itself? Superior setting, lackluster art work.

owner_response.author: Katie Z, Public Relations Manager at Urban Institute for Contemporary Arts, responded to this review
owner_response.text: wilwriter, we’re sorry you did not fully enjoy your experience at The Urban Institute for Contemporary Arts (UICA).  Contemporary art often deals with contemporary issues and the content and themes present in ‘UNLOADED’ are highly relevant and are certainly part of conversations being had globally. While we understand the exhibition can perhaps be translated into a social commentary, we believe that our community's varying perspectives, as well as the diverse perspectives of the artists whose works are included in the show, and the vision of the exhibition Curator herself, will assist in creating a valuable dialogue about the role of guns in America. We hope you’ll visit us again soon and will give our gallery another chance during one of our forthcoming exhibitions. We appreciate and value your feedback and thank you for taking the time to let us know.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great art in a beautiful space.
data.text: The only problem is parking. It connects to a lot, but it is very expensive. The films are great and often you will get a private showing.

data.title: Love
data.text: There are so many fun activities from movies to different events. Overall it is a great experience, and it is in the heart of downtown. It is easy to walk to other places from here, so you don't have to look for another parking spot.

owner_response.author: Katie Z, Public Relations Manager at Urban Institute for Contemporary Arts, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks so much for your review of UICA kklewis15! We are so proud of our organization and we are thrilled that you are too. Be sure to visit us again soon. Thanks for your support.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Fun fun fun. Inspiring
data.text:
I absolutely loved this place. 

It's a place that feeds your soul. 

I will visit here every time I am in Grand Rapids, without a doubt.

owner_response.author: Katie Z, Public Relations Manager at Urban Institute for Contemporary Arts, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks for your review, DominoP3!
We're very proud of our organization and your experience is important to us.
We hope you visit Grand Rapids again soon and stop by to visit us while you are in town. 
Kind Regards,
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: I hate Contemporary Art
data.text: So, based on my title, you might think I am going to rip on this place. Wrong! It is well maintained, clean, well situated and well staffed. We have only been there for ArtPrize, but are impressed with the facility. We are both a little old-fashioned when it come to art, so the usual stuff will never appeal to us. I understand they have a movie theater there, but we have not attended. But, for ArtPrize, do not miss this place as they always have a few of the big, good, modern pieces that are good, probably the best for that type of art in the city.

owner_response.author: Katie Z, Public Relations Manager at Urban Institute for Contemporary Arts, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Russ, thank you so much for your glowing review! We appreciate your support and we hope you'll visit us again soon. We are already planning our next ArtPrize exhibition and we look forward to sharing it. PS - we may be a little biased, but our Movie Theater is top notch! 
See you soon, Russ.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Movies
data.text: This is not just an Art Prize location. Has an year round exhibit space. However, it's the movie side of UICA which is truly good. The best place in West Michigan to watch independent/foreign movies.

owner_response.author: Katie Z, Public Relations Manager at Urban Institute for Contemporary Arts, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks for visiting and for reviewing our organization, ptrav9!
We are so proud of our Movie Theater and we are glad you visited. Stop by again soon - we have a great selection of films coming up!

Cheers,
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great place right in the heart of city!
data.text: Great place to go to get out of the heat and to view some art! Their gift shop is very well priced, with lots of different items.

data.title: Nice, but smaller that you may think.
data.text:
Nice space, right in Downtown GR, so accessible either by walking, bus or car. Parking per$ is available.
Even though the pkace looks huge from the outside, the actual exhibit space is not that big, given that there is a whole floor for administrative purposes. Only visited during free events.  Paid admission exhibits are not affordable by young art students.

owner_response.author: Lorraine808, Manager at Urban Institute for Contemporary Arts, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Thanks very much for your positive review. I hope that you were able to visit all four floors of our gallery spaces - they total 40,000 sq ft. There are periods of time where certain galleries are closed for the installation of new exhibits, so that might have been the case when you came in.

Our gallery admission is $5; we also offer student/artist annual memberships for $25, which gets you free admission to the galleries, and 1/2 off of movie tickets (just $4). I hope that you will consider becoming a member to take advantage of these and other perks. Have a great day!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Favorite GR Venue
data.text: I absolutely love the UICA. This is a must see when visiting the awesome city of GR. I really enjoy showing this venue off to my friends. There is always something new to see in this space. Make sure to check out any special events that may be offered during your visit. There are often speakers, discussions, and events surrounding the exhibitions. It is a really inclusive and inviting environment to explore!  The outdoor patio on the roof is blissful, with a great view of the city yet an aura of peacefulness fill the area. I never leave without stopping by the gift shop to see the fabulous works of local artists featured.

data.title: A Disappointing Gallery
data.text: UICA has a nice space in a contemporary building devoted to various kinds of artistic expression. When I first walked in I had high hopes, there were some interesting works on the walls. As I advanced through the galleries, located on multiple floors, those hopes turned to disappointment. While there were a few interesting pieces through out, the overall quality was lacking and so to was the way the work was displayed. It felt more like a community gallery, rather then the very lofty Urban Institute for Contemporary Arts. This is a gallery in need of more direction.

data.title: Fantastic Community Art Organization!
data.text: What a fantatstic place for the artist community.  Great exhibits and really cool indy movies and documentaries.  So glad Grand Rapids has this place!

data.title: An art fair paraded as an art exhibit
data.text: It seemed a bit odd to go to a contemporary art gallery and see price tags on the work. While some of the works were acknowledged with various prizes and cash rewards there was little evidence of curatorship. The moments of genius were few and the quality inconsistent. I WOULD ONLY GO BACK FOR A SPECIFIC SHOW AND AIM FOR A SPEAKER OR OPENING.

owner_response.author: Katie Z, Public Relations Manager at Urban Institute for Contemporary Arts, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi Ralph,

Thank you for your feedback about your experience with us. We'll be sure to consider your review when sharing this show with our community next year. The Festival of the Arts Regional exhibition is the centerpiece exhibition of Grand Rapids' annual Festival of the Arts. For more information about Festival of the Arts, visit festivalgr.org.

We hope you'll visit us again soon and encourage you to check our website often to plan your next visit around a specific exhibition or speaker.
Thanks very much.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A Sophisticated Artistic Gallery - Must-See Attraction
data.text: I've been to many art exhibits at The Urban Institute of Contemporary Arts during ArtPrize and other art festivals downtown. This artistic space is one of the best with a clean, chic look that emphasizes the artwork well. I highly recommend going to any exhibit they have going on because it's truly inspiring to see such a variety of mediums and artists portrayed.

data.title: Family outing with art prize
data.text:
We visited during Art prize and found the museum to be rather modern but lacking a family interest. 
The odd thing about the museum is that the cafe is in the basement which really isn't easily reconized or located very easily.
But overall it's a uplifting cultural experience.

data.title: Don't Miss the UICA - Grand Rapids MI
data.text: The Urban Institute of Contemporary Arts is a 'must see' in GR.  There's always something  going on. There's an exhibition there now that opened this month with paintings, photos, drawings, sculpture, and it is part of the DisArt Festival, city-wide.  It's called Art of the Lived Experiment.  Depending on the day you visit, there are usually movies playing as well. But be sure to come back in the fall during ArtPrize 2015.  You'll love it!

data.title: The Must-See Artistic Place In Grand Rapids
data.text: Having worked here in the summer being accepted into the Art Works program, I realized how much more I love the UICA. So many artistic, friendly staff members and really cool art around the building. Not only is it exciting here every day of the year, but it is crowded and really exciting during Artprize! I plan to visit this place for years and years to come!

data.title: Great place to see limited release films
data.text: We really enjoyed the UICA.  Unfortunately we were there in between exhibits - as they were getting ready for ArtPrize, but we enjoyed what we saw and plan to come back during ArtPrize.  The theatre was excellent and we really enjoyed the film we went to see.  The kids enjoyed the art and ambience in the theatre waiting area and the snacks were also affordable and good.  We now keep an eye on their website to check for upcoming films!  The theatre is a hidden gem that more folks could enjoy!

data.title: Moved then closed
data.text: We drove from Detroit then discovered it changed locations. When we arrived at new location a snotty young man told us it was closed for a private event. He gave us no additional information so we left. We will never return. There are too many other places in beautiful, friendly, cultured Grand Rapids to waste our money here.

owner_response.author: UICA, Manager at Urban Institute for Contemporary Arts, responded to this review
owner_response.text: The UICA did move from Sheldon St. to its current location at 2 Fulton St. W. in 2011. We are very sorry that the UICA was closed for a special event on the day that you visited, and that the staff member you spoke to was not courteous. We hope that you'll take a look at our updated exhibits, events, and film listings at www.uica.org and visit again soon.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Love to see the diversity of artists the city has to offer.
data.text: I love to go here just to open my mind.  It's fun to see modern art that isn't famous just expressive. The diversity that is available makes it more interesting and somewhere you have to visit often. With the low price point that's certainly and option.  Plus the new building is very contemporary and I believe LEED certified, but I could be mistaken about that.
